scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica and Bob still seem unconvinced. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'I just don't see how this is going to work.' Bob looks at you, exasperated, 'Are we really going to keep pushing everyone this hard?' You opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
scenes.description: Monica sighs and says, 'I think we're setting ourselves up for failure here.'

options.text: I hear you, Monica. Why don't we list out our biggest challenges and see if there's a way to tackle them more efficiently?
options.analysis: You acknowledged Monica's concerns and suggested a structured approach to address them, showing high empathy and good social skills.

options.text: It's understandable to feel this way, but we need to stay focused. If anyone has a better idea, please share it.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and open the floor for suggestions, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: I get it, but we need to keep moving forward. Complaining won't get us anywhere.
options.analysis: You pushed the team to continue working despite their concerns, showing strong self-regulation but lacking empathy.
